description.narrative: - Extend and improve the quality of telecommunications services: TCell plans to invest heavily in its network by upgrading and expanding coverage. This is expected to improve service for its subscribers and result in access in areas of the country that were not covered in the past. TCell''s investment program will also compel other operators to invest in their networks, leading to improvements across the industry as a whole and benefiting the general population. - Direct and indirect employment: Due to the limited employment opportunities domestically, nearly half of Tajikistan''s labor force works abroad. This project is expected to generate employment opportunities in the local market at both a Company level and across the supply chain. - Support delivery of Social Services: In 2002 TCell launched 3G services under its Indigo Tajikistan brand, making the country one of the first in the former Soviet Union to have a 3G network. Due to the lack of fixed line, broadband infrastructure, the country''s 3G network is relied on for the transmission of data and mobile internet access. As applications such as mobile banking and eGovernment services come on line, TCell''s extensive network will allow these services to reach a larger share of the population. - Demonstration Effect: IFC has taken a leading role in in the telecom sector as a pioneer investor in post-conflict and IDA countries, such as Afghanistan, Sierra Leone, West Bank and Haiti. IFC''s participation in this project would send a positive signal to other investors about Tajikistan''s investment potential despite perceptions about a challenging business environment and country risk. Although it grew significantly in the years that followed the 1992-1997 civil war, foreign direct investment remains limited.

With approximately 3.1 million subscribers and a market share of 36%, TCell (or the Company) is Tajikistans largest mobile phone operator. Established in 1998, it is also the countrys first mobile operator. TeliaSonera acquired a controlling stake in the Company in July 2007 and AKFED, which was a shareholder at the time of TeliaSoneras purchase, owns the remainder of the Company. TCell is seeking to raise US$30 million from the IFC to expand the services it offers and its geographic reach within Tajikistan. Over the next five years the Company intends to grow its mobile broadband and value added services.

mailing-address.narrative: Yernar Nakisbekov Chief Financial Officer Tcell, Part of TeliaSonera 34 Rudaki Avenue, Tcell Plaza, Dushanbe, 734025, Republic of Tajikistan

name.narrative: TCell is headquartered in Dushanbe, Tajiksitan with operations across the entire country.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
